answerText: ribosome[10] This is the general name given to any RNA capable of catalyzing chemical reactions. One of these that cleaves itself to replicate is called "hammerhead."
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 12 | 6 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Answer some questions about the catalytic properties of RNA, for 10 points each: [10] The catalytic sections of these organelles are composed of RNA, including the peptidyltransferase. This organelle is responsible for translating RNA messages into protein.
